Class Component<T extends Component<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kuujo.vertigo.network.Component<T>

    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Module, Verticle

extends Object
implements Serializable
    A network component.

    Jordan Haltermam

      • fromJson

        public static Component<?> fromJson(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject json)
                             throws MalformedNetworkException
        Creates a component instance from JSON.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON representation of the component instance.
        Returns:
        A constructed component instance.
        Throws:
        MalformedNetworkException - If the component definition is malformed.

      • getAddress

        public String getAddress()
        Returns the component address. This address is an event bus address at which the component will register a handler to listen for connections when started. Thus, this address must be unique.
        Returns:
        The component address.

      • getType

        public String getType()
        Returns the component type, either "module" or "verticle".
        Returns:
        The component type.

      • getConfig

        public org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject getConfig()
        Returns the component configuration.
        Returns:
        The component configuration.

      • setConfig

        public T setConfig(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config)
        Sets the component configuration. This configuration will be passed to component implementations as the verticle or module configuration when the component is started.
        Parameters:
        config - The component configuration.
        Returns:
        The called component instance.

      • getInstances

        public int getInstances()
        Returns the number of component instances.
        Returns:
        The number of component instances.

      • getHeartbeatInterval

        public long getHeartbeatInterval()
        Returns the component heartbeat interval.
        Returns:
        The component heartbeat interval.

      • setHeartbeatInterval

        public T setHeartbeatInterval(long interval)
        Sets the component heartbeat interval. This is the interval at which the component will send heartbeat messages to the network's coordinator. It may be necessary to increase heartbeat frequency if the component blocks frequently.
        Parameters:
        interval - The component heartbeat interval.
        Returns:
        The called component instance.

      • addHook

        public T addHook(InputHook hook)
        Adds an input hook to the component. The output hook can be used to receive notifications on events that occur within the component's InputCollector instance. If the hook requires constructor arguments or otherwise contains any state, the hook should implement the Serializable interface. Serializable hooks will be serialized with state, but non-serializable hooks will be reconstructed from the class name only. This means for the hook to be properly started, it must be available on the class path of the deployed component verticle or module.
        Parameters:
        hook - An input hook.
        Returns:
        The called component instance.
        See Also:
        InputHook}

      • addHook

        public T addHook(OutputHook hook)
        Adds an output hook to the component. The output hook can be used to receive notifications on events that occur within the component's OutputCollector instance. If the hook requires constructor arguments or otherwise contains any state, the hook should implement the Serializable interface. Serializable hooks will be serialized with state, but non-serializable hooks will be reconstructed from the class name only. This means for the hook to be properly started, it must be available on the class path of the deployed component verticle or module.
        Parameters:
        hook - An output hook.
        Returns:
        The called component instance.
        See Also:
        OutputHook}

      • addHook

        public T addHook(ComponentHook hook)
        Adds a component hook to the component. The output hook can be used to receive notifications on events that occur within the component instance's inputs and outputs. If the hook requires constructor arguments or otherwise contains any state, the hook should implement the Serializable interface. Serializable hooks will be serialized with state, but non-serializable hooks will be reconstructed from the class name only. This means for the hook to be properly started, it must be available on the class path of the deployed component verticle or module.
        Parameters:
        hook - A component hook.
        Returns:
        The called component instance.
        See Also:
        ComponentHook}

      • getInputs

        public List<Input> getInputs()
        Gets a list of component inputs.
        Returns:

      • addInput

        public Input addInput(Input input)
        Adds a component input.
        Parameters:
        input - The input to add.
        Returns:
        The new input instance.

      • addInput

        public Input addInput(String address)
        Adds a component input.
        Parameters:
        address - The input address. This is the event bus address of a component to which this component will listen for output.
        Returns:
        The new input instance.

      • addInput

        public Input addInput(String address,
             Grouping grouping)
        Adds a component input with a grouping.
        Parameters:
        address - The input address. This is the event bus address of a component to which this component will listen for output.
        grouping - An input grouping. This input grouping helps determine how messages will be distributed among multiple instances of this component.
        Returns:
        The new input instance.

      • addInput

        public Input addInput(String address,
             Filter... filters)
        Adds a component input with filters.
        Parameters:
        address - The input address. This is the event bus address of a component to which this component will listen for output.
        filters - A list of input filters.
        Returns:
        The new input instance.

      • addInput

        public Input addInput(String address,
             Grouping grouping,
             Filter... filters)
        Adds a component input with grouping and filters.
        Parameters:
        address - The input address. This is the event bus address of a component to which this component will listen for output.
        grouping - An input grouping. This input grouping helps determine how messages will be distributed among multiple instances of this component.
        filters - A list of input filters.
        Returns:
        The new input instance.

        public abstract ComponentContext createContext()
                                        throws MalformedNetworkException
        Creates a component context from the component definition.
        Returns:
        A component context.
        Throws:
        MalformedNetworkException - If the component definition is invalid.
